intro: Calyptrostegia clutioides, commonly known as the African velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant produces capsules as its fruit, which contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
